summary: This document is an email chain between Gary Bloxsome, a partner at Blackfords LLP in London, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The correspondence concerns a U.S. request to interview Bloxsome's client, referred to as 'the Duke,' for a voluntary witness statement in connection with a criminal investigation, likely related to the Epstein case. Bloxsome expresses concerns about confidentiality and the DOJ's past conduct.

persons.name: Gary Bloxsome
persons.role: Partner at Blackfords LLP, legal representative
persons.context: He is the author of the primary emails, representing a client referred to as 'the Duke' in negotiations with the U.S. Department of Justice regarding a voluntary witness statement. He raises concerns about confidentiality and past unfair treatment.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.role: Prosecutor, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The recipient of Bloxsome's emails, representing the U.S. Department of Justice. They are engaged in correspondence to arrange an interview with Bloxsome's client for the DOJ's criminal investigation.

connections.description: They are engaged in professional correspondence regarding a U.S. request for a witness statement from Bloxsome's client. The relationship is adversarial in the context of legal negotiations.
Bloxsome is the legal representative for an individual referred to as 'the Duke,' who is the subject of a U.S. request for a voluntary witness statement.
The U.S. Attorney is seeking to interview 'the Duke' as part of a criminal investigation, aiming to obtain a voluntary witness statement.

events.title: Media leak regarding MLA request
events.description: A leak to the world's media occurred regarding the existence of a Mutual Legal Assistance (MLA) request from the United States, which increased concerns about confidentiality.

events.title: Email from U.S. Attorney to Bloxsome
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney sent an email to Gary Bloxsome, which is referenced in his reply on June 8.

events.title: Bloxsome's initial sensitive correspondence
events.description: Gary Bloxsome sent an initial email to the U.S. Attorney raising concerns and seeking confirmations regarding the request for a voluntary witness statement from his client.

keyFacts: The U.S. Department of Justice has formally sought assistance via the UK Central Authority to interview a client of Gary Bloxsome, referred to as 'the Duke,' for a voluntary witness statement.

Bloxsome expresses significant concerns about past 'unfair treatment' of the Duke by the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York and the DOJ's failure to uphold promises of confidentiality.
A media leak on June 7, 2020, about the existence of the MLA request heightened concerns about the confidentiality of the process.
Bloxsome seeks explicit confirmation that communications will be confidential and that any witness statement will be used solely for the DOJ's criminal investigations.

The correspondence indicates ongoing negotiations about the format of the witness statement, with the U.S. side referring to it as a 'live interview' to be conducted in person or via video conference.
